temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content: Brucella can grow at temperatures between 20 - 40°C, although its optimal temperature is 34°C.

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: Brucellae are strictly aerobic, but certain strains require a CO2 enriched atmosphere (5 - 10%) in order to grow.

ph.title: pH
ph.content: Brucella grows optimally in environments with a pH between 6.6 - 7.4 but can survive with a pH between 5.8 - 8.7.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content: The survival of Brucella (B. abortus and B. melitensis) in the environment is promoted by humid conditions.

salinity.title: Salinity
salinity.content: Brucella is able to survive a salinity concentration of 4%, but its optimum is 0,4%.
